usefulItems: cling wrap, rolling pin, baking sheet (approx. 16 in. x 14 in.), parchment paper, wire rack, refrigerator, oven
title: Quick Puff Pastry

ingredients.content: 7 oz unsalted butter, diced (½ -1 in.), frozen
7 oz all-purpose flour, plus extra to dust

preparations.content: Place butter, flour, chilled water and salt into mixing bowl and mix <b>20 sec/speed 6<b>. Remove dough from mixing bowl. Dough will appear crumbly. Form into a ball and flatten into a rough square. Wrap pastry in cling wrap and refrigerate for 20 minutes.

Unwrap dough and place onto a lightly floured work surface. Roll out dough with a rolling pin into a long rectangle 3 times as long as it is wide (approx. 24 in. x 8 in). Fold dough into thirds and give folded dough a quarter turn so that the fold is on the left. Repeat rolling and folding process twice, then return to refrigerator for 20 minutes or place in freezer for 5 minutes before using.
Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet (approx. 16 in. x 14 in.) with parchment and set aside.

Roll dough into a rectangle (¼ in. thick) and cut into required shape or shapes right before baking. Bake for 20 minutes (400°F) for one large piece of pastry, 12-15 minutes (400°F) for smaller pastries, or as directed by other recipes. Allow to cool on a wire rack before serving or storing in an airtight container.

hintsAndTricks: This pastry serves as a base for cakes, pastries, cream puffs and fruit pies.

The success of this recipe depends on keeping the pastry dough chilled so the layers of butter do not melt. A cold work surface (marble or stone) and a cool room temperature are helpful. If at any time during the process the dough feels warm, place into the freezer for 5 minutes before rolling out again. To prevent the dough from sticking to the work surface, whenever necessary use a light dusting of flour, or roll dough between two sheets of parchment.
Puff pastry dough freezes very well before baking. Defrost in the refrigerator before using. Partially rolling out the dough before freezing allows for faster defrosting.
Once baked, pastry keeps well for up to 15 days stored in a sealed container in a cool dry place.
Replace water with very cold white wine.
